ï»¿Review_title: This is the best college one could get into NITT
Body:
College Infrastructure
This is 800 acres campus the largest among all NIT's not to brag this is the best college I could get into. There are so many facilities in NIT Trichy, There are so many hostels for boys and girls with various types of rooms. The institution has a modern central library. Our institution also have a sports complex that has all kinds of indoor and outdoor sports. The wifi in our hostel rooms is very fast and there are various food messes for different people and its completely hygienic there.
Academics
I opted Instrumentation and Control Engineering shortly termed as ICE here which is basically a Circuital and non-circuital branch, which is also the main reason I opted this course because I can have exposure to both the sectors. This course mainly deals with the controlling of Sensory machines and Jobs like controlling engineer is perfectly suitable. The faculty working here are highly qualified and they teach really great although a bit strict though. the curriculum is perfectly updated here
Placements
Our branch has high percentage of placed students from past 7 years. There are many MNC's and startup coming from various sectors and offering various types of jobs through our placement cell. not only my branch every brach has average of 90-95% of placed students and highest is 42 LPA from CSE department. the average salary packages differ for department but in common it will be around 9-12 LPA, The process is so easy for placements cause placement cell will be guiding you and it is supportive
Value-for-money
As of first year the fee structure is bit high compared to remaining years So considering all expenses in mind it will be like 1.4 Lakhs in first semester but from them the fees will be like 75-80,000 as I was in my home because of COVID for two years I did'nt need to pay my hostel fee so It is reduced compared to above figures. Off course I feel worth for this money because compared to private Institutions and other NIT's this is relatively less and I have a great campus, excellent education.
Campus Life
Its really good because college life is best as a teenager and here in NIT-T you have various types of entertaining, technical clubs where you can develop your knowledge and Improve your social skills. There is Pragyan and other cultural fests which are one of the biggest events in India so you'll definitely. The support staff is so polite and helps you in knowing about their local langauge. Yes it is safe because we have hospital in case of emergency and people here also so kind you can be good
Anything Else
as I almost told everything in the above lines there isn't much to add but this is The best college I can get into in my life cause I overcame my fears with what I have learnt from here and there are many good activities one can do either sports or academical. SO, I would recommend anyone to join in my college if they have a better score in JEE .

College Infrastructure
NIT-Trichy is gifted with excellent infrastructure buttressed by modern facilities and equipment. The central library is filled with oodles of books spanning various subjects, catering to the diverse interests of the students.

My department boasts of experienced and accomplished faculty, and from what I have heard from my friends in other departments, the same holds for them too. Teachers can only act as catalysts in our learning endeavour and only with an effort from our side, can we reap the fruits of the lectures. So, it comes as no surprise that much of our learning takes place outside the confines of the classroom. The subjects are updated regularly incorporating the recent developments in the different fields.
Placements
NIT-Trichy lives up to the expectations when it comes to placements. I, being in the second year, haven't gone through the placement process myself, but the placement statistics' of the senior batches have been encouraging. In 2019, 96.2% of B.Tech students who applied for placements got placed, and the average package was 6.25 lakh.

Body:
College Infrastructure
I don't like the campus that much. The reason is it's not well planned. Each building is at a large distance from the other.The campus also lacks greenery.It doesn't have a single green ground. Though the campus has many small halls but doesn't have a single air conditioned auditorium with a capacity of 3000-4000 people. Talking about the classrooms, their are two complexes in which classes happen. But only few rooms have air conditioning facility and rooms in old complex are like that of school
Academics
Academics here are mostly similar to that of Tier-1 college . In the first year syllabus is mostly same irrespective of departments. But you have to study courses that you will feel like useless and are not related to your field. Also the college provieds opportunity to students to do a minor in any course from any department 2nd year onwards. Though almost all the profs are experienced but teaching style of most of them is boring. So the students mostly learn by themselves.
Placements
As I am still in first year, I don't know exact figures about placements but as I have heard,the placements are really good every year with most of students getting placed. Though the percentage of placements is above 85 for all departments, packages do vary. The CSE department students gets high packages in good number as compared to other,followed by ECE. Average package generally goes around 7-8 lpa ,highest being 40-45 lpa.
Value-for-money
The fees for a general category student is around 2 lakhs for each year including mess and hostel fees. With decent services being provided, I think it is worth it . The mess and hostel fee is minimal justifying the food quality and hostel premises.
Campus Life
It mainly depend on you how you want to enjoy your college life. The college has many extra-curricular and technical societies which regularly participate in national level competition. College also conducts a lot of fests annually , The frontrunner being PRAGYAN and FESTEMBER. The college campus is located on the outskirts,22-23 km from the city , so you are kinda disconnected. But due to good local transport ,buses run to and from the city throughout the day. So you can Hangout on weekends.

Body:
College Infrastructure
Our campus provides most of the necessary facilities like, sports pitches for different sports, a magnificent library, Octagon Computer center which is open 24X7. The laboratories in Mechanical engineering department are filled with several equipment. The hostel WiFi slows down during peak hours most of the times. Otherwise it is just fine. The living places are cleaned up frequently. But they are not as hygienic as they should be. Even the food messes aren't very hygienic.
Academics
I'm doing Mechanical engineering because I've been passionate about it since my teenage started. The curriculum needs more update. For eg, in Automobile engineering we still study technology that hasn't been in the industry for the past 10-15 years. We need to know about Electric vehicle technology, Artificial intelligence, etc. But our faculty are forced to move out of curriculum and take extra hours to help us learn these. A lot of efforts outside curriculum are required to make us job-ready.
Placements
The Training and Placement office of NIT Trichy does an excellent job in bringing down several companies for each domain. The procedure is systematic. 90% of the students sitting for placements from mechanical engineering get placed generally. Highest salary package was around 60 lpa to a Computer Science student. Average salary for mechanical engineering companies is 6 lpa. Overall, 10-15 lpa. The process involves a lot of steps and takes a week per company on an average.
Value-for-money
The course costs Rs. 99,000 per semester, which is 2 lakhs per year. This includes mess, academic, hostel fees. The expenditure is not so high here. I do feel we are getting our money's worth, when compared to other engineering colleges in India. The competition among the top-notch students helps everyone studying there, pushing us to work hard. The faculty aren't too bad either. Placements are almost guaranteed. The Letters of Recommendation from profs here are totally worth it.
Campus Life
Campus is huge. It feels to lonely at times due to the forest-y appearance. The best thing here is the presence of around 50 technical clubs and as many non-technical clubs as well. We improve our personality being in college fest teams too. We find no student who doesn't engage in any of them. The location is not good. The campus is 25 km away from the city. Safety has been a huge issue here, especially women safety.
Anything Else
If not for a few issues like safety, curriculum, rules, etc this college maintains what it takes to be among the top engineering colleges in India.

Body:
College Infrastructure
Well the infrastructure majorly depends on what branch are you from. For example, the mechanical branch uses a pretty old building but cse,ece,eee,ice uses new infrastructure. You can enjoy the campus to the fullest but there are certain areas where boys and girls are not allowed respectively. The campus is around 800 acres most of which is unused but the climate of trichy is very humid so sometimes it's hotter than one could expect. The library is huge with almost everything you need.
Academics
Like any other college here too there is vagueness in the teaching quality. But it's pretty obvious that one might find mathematics more interesting than environmental science right? Some professors are really good while others are not so good. But once you enter in 2ndsemester here you hardly depend on any professors. And that's a very good thing but you will realise it only when you experience it. The curriculum is not so updated yet but as of now HOD's are trying their best to bring in new cu
Placements
I can not emphasize on this more "placements depends on the quality of students and the work placement committee of your college puts in". And place-com of nit-trichy is in top-10 in india which includes even the IIMs. Coming to average packages, cse is the Highest with around 20+lpa and overall it's around 7-8lpa. And percentage of students placed too again depends majorly on students themselves because there are around 200 companies visiting the campus every year.
Value-for-money
The fees depends upon your category. Like for sc st the tuition fee is totally free. You can check anything related to this on the official website anytime or even on websites like careers360. Coming to the worth of money, the mess food generally is unlimited and it's better than one would expect. I know that's hard to believe but if you choose the right mess you'll get almost home cooked food. The hostels are very clean so is the campus (unless it rains and nothing is in our hand ;p ).
Campus Life
Again this majorly depends on whether you are a boy or a girl. Because for girls there's a daily curfew of 9pm on weekdays and 9:30pm on weekends while for boys in the first year there's curfew of 9pm daily but rest of the years there's no curfew. You'll meet the best people ever if you make the right choices and choose the right group you hangout with. The location of college is the one among the very few setbacks it has because first of all it's in Tiruchirapalli and then it's away from city.
Anything Else
The best feature about tier-1 colleges like top-5 iits,bitsnit Trichy is the Pier group one gets. And here in Nit Trichy there's a wonderful culture of clubs (technical, research, dance, music, astronomy, business you name it) and fests(where everything is planned and organised by the students which develops very important skills one needs for leadership roles in future). Hostel life is Just the best among everything. There's a computer lab too which is accessible 24/7 and has great internet.

Body:
NIT Trichy boasts of a vast campus with ever-improving infrastructure (new lecture halls, bigger auditoriums, refurbished library, new hostels) to accommodate the increasing number of students. Hostels are just about okay, but fortunately there arenât any problems with water supply at least. First years share their rooms with three other students, second and third year students with one more, while final year students normally have a room to themselves, although that may change a bit due to the increased intake of NIT Trichy. The entire campus is WiFi enabled, but as of now they have huge computer rooms in each hostel which are open 24 hours a day. Specialised internet labs are also available. Students sometimes complain about the ânot so greatâ library, but that promises to improve too very soon.
Hostel life in nit trichy is pretty enjoyable. As all colleges you will have regular exams, but apart from that all the time u can chill. There is curfew for first years but even that is flexible. Rules are stricter for girls, so forget romantic moonlight walk. Overall life is enjoyable. There are good and bad people everywhere, it only depends on who you associate with.
College life is filled with activities around the year. The annual cultural festival ('Festember') , Techno-management festival ('Pragyan') are complemented by department symposiums, inter departmental cultural fests, club activities (which include technical and cultural events). Technical and cultural fests are organised on a very large scale and the entire year is spent on making every edition better than the previous one. Individual hostels, inter-hostels, inter year events are conducted by various clubs, and the hostels themselves. Round the year there are sports events, social and cultural activities, technical competitions, workshops, and lectures (on robotics , computing , etc ).

Body:
Studying here you will get a privilege of studying in "The Best" NIT of India (according to MHRD rankings 2016) with much standard facilities companred to all other NITs and a feww IITs too. There a plenty of opportunities for pursuing research either in your branch, or in your out of curriculum interest, which will be very much encouraged from the faculty too. College administration has recently revamped the educational system from batch 2015-2019 onwards which gives flexibility for faculty to conduct exams (Yes, you read it right, faculty and students decide when to have exams rather than an old school model of strict schedule). This flexibility might not be in everyone's interest especially when the faculty decides to keep students romancing with books even in the hostels. 

Placemeny Scenario:-
The placement offers are of well standards in the circuital branches (CSE,ECE,EEE etc.,) as they easily land in jobs where they work on what they have studied in engineering.When the case is of non-circuital branches (Metallurgy, Mechanical,Civil, etc.,) the scenario is very different. Many lamd in jobs which is something which they learn only after joining. But these jobs are the most lucrative ones one can get in NITT and so many people will be willing to get placed in such jobs rather than something related to what they have studied.
College Life inside NIT Trichy:-

1)Hostel and Mess:
Hostels are really good compared to what you see in many other NITs and IITs. The best part (atleast for me :p) is that this college provides you with 4 different cuisines of foods - North Indian cuisine Tamil Nadu cuisine,  Andhra cuisine and Kerala cuisine with options of vegetarian and non-vegetarian foods so that you wont miss home food atleast to some extent.

2) Sports:
NIT Trichy has stadiums dedicated for Basketball, Tennis, Badminton, Cricket and Football. It also has a gym, Swimming Pool, Running track and facilities for many indoor games too. The environment of campus will surely intrigue you to take up some sport activity.

3) Clubs and Campus Fests:
This is where majority of students spend their time in by interest and not by a compelling force of "Mandatory 75% attendance". You name a club and NIT Trichy has it :D. Clubs and campus fests are what make your memories memorable in the College Life, and these clubs are so encouraged that the administration even funds and encourages everyone to be a part of some club so that the boy/girl entering the campus leaves as a men/women. And the campus fests are organised by the students with professionality that which I have not seen even in top IITs or other premium colleges of India.

But even after having such splendid facilities no one, except you, can make the best out of NITT and that's why its a heaven for opportunists.

NIT Trichy gives you an exposure which can undoubtedly compared to IITs , and plays a major role in carving out the best in you.

ï»¿Review_title: Best place to spend 4 years after so much hard work for JEE.
Body:
It is indeed a golden opportunity to be in this prestigious institute and pursue your bachelor's. The first we step out of our home and we land in this college is like a dream. The 800-acre campus is so huge that before we could reach the entrance to the college, we can find few department buildings from the highway. The clock tower, the icon of the institute can be seen near the admin block after the entrance. The institute has two massive lecture hall complex where regular classes take place. Each department has its own building where the labs are set up. The computer centre (Octagon) provides internet facilities to the whole campus. There are so many hostels spread across the campus to accommodate all the 5000 odd students. The library is one of the biggest libraries in South Indian colleges. Most important thing is the 24x7 open Cafe Coffee Day outlet which serves freshly brewed coffee at a huge discount. There are other restaurants too inside the campus. Buhari (non-veg), Vasantham (veg and non-veg), Staff canteen (pure veg. note: you get the best coffee here in the campus). There are small shops near few hostels. Roadside Dhabas are there outside the campus which are very busy during the nights.
Recreational facilities are provided in every hostel. Each hostel has a TT room and carrom room. The Sports complex has a GYM, Table tennis room, badminton hall, carrom and chess room. There is tennis court, basket ball court, volleyball court and swimming pool near the sports complex. There is a huge ground for track events and cricket and another ground for football. A small ground is being developed for hockey. There are several smaller grounds near the hostels where students play cricket/football.
The students come from all over the country though there is a 50% reservation for Tamil Nadu students. The girls strength is very less in the campus (8:1 ratio). But it really doesn't matter when it comes to studies or events, they take part very actively and contribute their best. Being amidst diverse people from all parts of the country, we get to know their culture and learn adapt with the cultural differences.
ECE department had the best faulty in the campus (my opinion). To mention a few Dr. Raghavan, Dr. B.Venkataramani, Prof. Bhaskar, Dr. P.Muthuchidambara Nathan have published so many research papers in most leading journals and have attended many international conferences. Dr. B.Venkataramani and Prof. Bhaskar have published a book on Digital Signal Processors which is the only book for that subject.
The fests Festember (Cultural Fest), Pragyan (Techo-Management Fest) are organized by the students. Pragyan is one of the biggest Techo-Management fest in South Asia where lectures by professors from leading universities around the world, workshop by industry experts are organized in the campus. Festember is rated in Top 10 cultural fests in India. All the 4 days of the fest involve various cultural events by the students from various institutes and guest performances by lead bands and performers.
Coming to placements, the institute has 100% placement records over the past few years. Companies like Microsoft, Facebook, Yahoo, Texas Instruments, QualComm, CISCO, nVIDIA do visit the campus and select the best minds in the campus. 
The college fees was very less when compared to any other private college in Chennai. It was 22000 per semester including exam fee, library, internet, etc and hostel fees was 18000 per semester. Availing loan was an easy task with SBI branch inside the campus.

Body:
My college life in this college has been worth treasuring for lifetime. It has provided me with platform and opportunities to grow beyond my imagination into a confident and responsible human being. The infrastructure when i entered in my first year ie in 2012 to what has manifested over 4 years now is a stark contrast. From a no water , no electricity campus with no proper roads to what is now a dream campus with a world class OAT, hostels , AC lecture halls and a own MIG aircraft. Infrastructure of the huge 770 acre campus is marvelous. Faculty, particularly in my department are of high caliber though a little arrogant and stubborn. Overall faculty quality of the college, including new recruits, is not very great but its certainly above any other average college.
Placements are phenomenal. Way better than all NITs and many IITs. There is something called Campus placement training for students in which students are trained to appear for placements. College is very serious and very well structured to handle the placements. In sports and recreational facilities , we have a beautiful swimming pool , a new huge gym , many basketball courts , indoor gym for girls , badminton courts , cricket ground , running track , indoor tennis stadium and what not. The distinguishing feature of this college is the clubs and college fest. The level of autonomy students have here in running the 52+ clubs and south india's biggest college fest is to be seen in no other college. From robotics club , computer club , IoT club to social welfare clubs to music and dance club , you name any field , and there would be an active club in that field. If not , the college administration is very flexible to inaugurate another club. Hostels are good. especially now that all the first year hostels are renovated. There is no power cut , 24 hour water , gyser , washing machine , wifi , etc. The mess food is ok , not great. We do have 3-4 restaurants in campus and also one Cafe Coffee Day. Just one negative thing is that the whether of trichy is very hot , almost throughout the year. Though hostel common rooms and classrooms are now being fitted with ACs, but if you want to go out in city , it can be pretty hot during the daytime.
Overall, this college will provide you with all the opportunities and knowledge source at your disposal, its upto you how you make use of it. I personally have gained alot and am grateful to this college.
